required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Stiffness and Pressure Applied on the Lower Leg by a New Compression Bandage on Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Stiffness and Pressure Applied on the Lower Leg by a New Compression Bandage on Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the stiffness and interface pressures of a new compression system URGOBD001 on healthy subjects, compares with a short stretch bandage and a multi component bandage.

detailed_description.textblock:
Compression therapy is widely used in the treatment of chronic venous leg ulcers (VLUs). The clinical performance of a compression system depends on the apply pressure and the stiffness.
The static stiffness index (SSI) is defined by the difference in interface pressure measured when the subject is standing (working pressure) and the interface pressure measured when the subject is in the lying position (resting pressure).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 3 separate sets : URGOBD001 SSI compared with the SSI of a short stretch bandage URGOBD001 SSI associated with wading bandage compared with the SSI of a short stretch bandage URGOBD001 SSI compared with the SSI of a multi component bandage.

primary_outcome.description: % of subject with a SSI≥ 10 mmHg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Hour 0 (Baseline) to Hour 72 (end of study) after application
From Hour 0 (Baseline) to Hour 72 after application

secondary_outcome.measure: Slippage of the bandage in cm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Hour 0 (Baseline) to Hour 72 (end of study) after application
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by measuring with a tape at each time (i) the length (L) from the top of the bandage to the floor, Slippage (cm) = L(Time 0) - L (Time i)

arm_group.description: Application with 50% overlap in combinaison with wading
Application with 50% overlap in combinaison with wading

intervention.description: Application with 50% overlapping in association with wading

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject with a body mass index of less than 30 (BMI = kg / m²),
- Subject presenting a healthy skin on both legs without any sign of dermatological lesion,
- Subject presenting a venous doppler of the lower limbs without detectable anomaly
- Subject with a ankle brachial pressure index (ABPI) greater than 0.9 and less than 1.3 for each of the lower limbs,
- Subject accepting to wear a compressive system on both legs for a period of three days.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject with chronic venous insufficiency whose stage is greater than or equal to 2 (CEAP classification of chronic venous diseases)
- Subject with type I or II diabetes
- Subject with lipoedema and / or dismorphic leg
- Subject presenting ankle ankylosis
